Note that this squad is numbered alphabetically by surname, unlike traditional numbering systems where the goalkeeper has shirt number 1 and so forth.

103MFRen\xc3\xa9 van de Kerkhof(1951-09-16)16 September 1951 (aged 26)20 PSV
113MFWilly van de Kerkhof(1951-09-16)16 September 1951 (aged 26)18 PSV
124FWRob Rensenbrink(1947-07-03)3 July 1947 (aged 30)34 Anderlecht
133MFJohan Neeskens(1951-09-15)15 September 1951 (aged 26)38 Barcelona
143MFJohan Boskamp(1948-10-21)21 October 1948 (aged 29)1 Molenbeek
152DFHugo Hovenkamp(1950-10-05)5 October 1950 (aged 27)7 AZ
164FWJohnny Rep(1951-11-25)25 November 1951 (aged 26)23 Bastia
172DFWim Rijsbergen(1952-01-18)18 January 1952 (aged 26)25 Feyenoord
184FWDick Nanninga(1949-01-17)17 January 1949 (aged 29)1 Roda JC
191GKPim Doesburg(1943-10-28)28 October 1943 (aged 34)2 Sparta Rotterdam
202DFWim Suurbier(1945-01-16)16 January 1945 (aged 33)56 Schalke 04
214FWHarry Lubse(1951-09-23)23 September 1951 (aged 26)1 PSV
222DFErnie Brandts(1956-02-03)3 February 1956 (aged 22)1 PSV
\n

Jan Jongbloed wore number 8 because some of the players who had been in the Dutch squad at the 1974 FIFA World Cup, where the Netherlands used a purely alphabetical numbering system, were given the same numbers again in 1978. Hugo Hovenkamp withdrew from the squad before the tournament began, but after the deadline for naming replacement players had passed. The Netherlands thus went to the World Cup with only 21 players.

\n

 Peru[edit]

\n

Head coach: Marcos Calder\xc3\xb3n

Notes: There was no qualification for the 1930 World Cup as places were given by invitation only. In 1950, there was no final; the article is about the decisive match of the final group stage.
